snippet: Prosecutors again failed to convince a jury that politicians, lobbyists and a casino owner had committed any crimes in their failed attempt to get the State Legislature to legalize gambling.
abstract: Six defendants, including three current or former state legislators, are found not guilty of a raft of corruption and bribery charges stemming from an attempt to get the Alabama State Legislature to legalize some forms of gambling; acquittals are the second time a federal jury has agreed that the backroom dealings of the group, while undesirable, were not illegal.
lead_paragraph: Prosecutors again failed to convince a jury that politicians, lobbyists and a casino owner had committed any crimes in their failed attempt to get the State Legislature to legalize gambling.

headline.seo: In Alabama, 2nd Corruption Trial Ends in Acquittals
headline.main: In Alabama, 2nd Corruption Trial Ends in Acquittals
headline.print_headline: In Alabama, 2nd Corruption Trial Ends in Acquittals
